content: Enrollment number – M/18/093  Commonly used study technique – referring lecture notes with memorizing answers for saq questions  How would you grade your stress? (Low/ Moderate/ High) - moderate   Commonly used coping strategies – watching youtube vedios   Self-evaluation   Good points of my studying – revising previously studied lecture notes    Weaknesses of my studying – take too much leisure time, when get stressed cannot concentrate    How should I improve my studying? – should answer saq questions     What type of guidance do I need? – discussion type

Hello! It's great to have the opportunity to chat with you today. I've had a chance to look over your self-evaluation data sheet, and it seems like you've got a good grasp on some of your study habits and areas where you'd like to improve. Let's start by talking about your study techniques. You mentioned that you commonly refer to lecture notes and memorize answers for SAQ questions. That's a solid start. How do you feel this method has been working out for you in terms of retaining information and applying it in exams?
it is good for answering saq questions at the exam

That's good to hear. Being able to effectively answer SAQ questions is definitely a strong skill to have, especially in medical exams where detailed knowledge is key. Since you've identified this as a strength, it might be beneficial to build on this foundation. Considering your interest in discussion-type guidance, have you thought about forming or joining a study group? This could be a great way to deepen your understanding of the material by explaining concepts to others and hearing different perspectives.
